result.execSummary:
All charges against William F Morris in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William F Morris is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William F Morris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William F Morris in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for William F Morris.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for final pretrial.  State does not have contact with the essential witness.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received, filed and forwarded to Judge for review.  bm
Pretrial Services Violation Report - 05-25-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant William F Morris not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Cash bail converted to a $1,000 signature bond. 
Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court orders matter adjourned back to Br. 01. 
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with L.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William F Morris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant William F Morris in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William F Morris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William F Morris not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 3/18/2022. Defendant is in custody at CJF.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/22 @ 2p
